topics.body:
"@hype":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55adbbab6368722fac001763#post_55adbbab6368722fac001763
[bq="hype"]"@EHAN":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55adbb5c63687232840004c4#post_55adbb5c63687232840004c4
what

if one fucks up then you have a backup

youre nuts dude[/bq]
I keep my games and consoles in the best condition possible, they've survived since pretty much launch without having to fix anything

The only stuff that's broken down actually as far as video game stuff goes is my original GameCube (the motor burned out from playing it so goddamn much), my first GameCube memory card (which works 85% of the time but sometimes fails to read anything so it might be on its last legs), my original brick Gameboy (battery casing and screen falling off), my Halo Reach disc (which got a crack in the middle so now it works maybe 10% of the time), and my physical copy of Pokemon Ruby (which might be counterfeit actually, but the save often decides to delete itself for no explainable reason).

Other than that my video game stuffs have been in great condition. My PS2 has lasted for eternity with no malfunctions whatsoever. And my original brick Gameboy, while kinda ugly looking with the tape holding the perishable stuff together, still plays Tetris like it did years back.
